page.title: 06THE HALLS
page.content: There are two halls in Ballygawley. One is beside the Catholic Church and the other is beside the Presbyterian Church. My granda is the caretaker of St.Ciaran's Hall.It was used for saying Mass in,two years ago when we had nowhere to say Mass. This was when the new church was being built. Now it is used for bingo,bowls,discos and parish meetings.Some times there are Bring and Buy sales in it.The other hall is used for much the same things. There is a shop in St.Ciaran's Hall as well as a kitchen where people can make a cup of tea. The hall was built in 1963.At Christmas time there is a bazaar for the children.Santa Claus comes and gives the children presents.He rings a bell and the children cheer and welcome him.So all ages of people use the halls.
